column4: i have 3 computers behind a switch. ubuntu (192.168.1.101) windows XP (.102) and windowsXP (.105) my ubuntu machine can ping .102 but it cannot ping .105... yet my 102 machine can ping .101 and .105.... and my router detects all three. what could be causing my ubuntu machine to not be able to ping .105?
yessir
my router is 192.168.1.1
is the windows firewall turned on for .102?
youseenothing, it's turned off for both, .102 and .105
let me go try. one second
i was wrong about .102 being able to ping .105... i cannot ping .105, but my router detects it.
alright, i'll work on it. thanks for the help
the ubuntu iptables rules would not by default block icmp replies
if your linux box can ping 102 (winxp) but can't with 105 (winxp) i would check firewall first
firewall on the 105 machine
my ubuntu (.101) and windowsXP (.102) can ping each other.... my other windowsXP machine (.105) cannot be pinged by either of them.... but it can ping my router (192.168.1.1)
because you said that 102 can't ping it either
youseenothing, it's disabled... i promise
can your 105 machine ping 101?
and windows is known for turning the firewall back on after a reboot for updates

youseenothing, i'll go test now.... gonna need a minute since i usually vnc into the machine... i gotta hook up a keyboard... the machine that usually vnc's into .105 is .100(but it's down right now due to hardware failures)
ok...and please make sure that the firewall is off and didn't suddenly get enabled
for my sanity!
ha!
and why wouldn't you be able to vnc in from any other machine on your network?
unless there are firewall rules blocking on 105
